coding.display: Substance with angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor mechanism of action (substance)
Hyperkalemia caused by angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor (disorder)

note.text: Patient pressed call button for vomiting. She reports she started feeling nauseated about ten minutes ago.

coding.display: Chronic kidney disease stage 3 due to type 2 diabetes mellitus (disorder)
Structure of middle cerebral artery M1 segment

note.text: Partial occlusion of MCA. Stroke event witnessed. EMS response / patient arrived within 45 minutes of symptom onset. Verified by CT with contrast. tPA administered within 2 hours of symptom onset.

coding.display: Functions of the joints and bones, other specified and unspecified
Functions related to the digestive system, other specified and unspecified
Anemia co-occurrent and due to chronic kidney disease stage 3 (disorder)
Power of muscles in lower half of the body

note.text: The weakness in the patient's lower extremities is secondary to deconditioning. According to the report from Neurology, patient did not have motor or sensory deficits below upper chest. High rehab potential.
Betsy is frustrated, embarrassed, and worried about not being able to undress herself
Betsy is frustrated, embarrassed, and worried about not being able to dress herself

coding.display: Power of muscles of one limb

note.text: The weakness and lack of coordination in the patient's right shoulder, arm, and hand are secondary to the stroke. PT/OT from SNF report improvements to rotator cuff strength over last month.

coding.display: Power of muscles on one side of the body

note.text: Patient began experiencing right sided weakness, primarily in arm and shoulder. There was no facial droop, but patient reports "tingling" in R face / numbness along R brow. Symptoms in face resolved post tPA administration. Strength improved in shoulder, weakness did not fully resolve. Demonstrates R arm weakness and lack of coordination. Fine motor skills significantly degraded and have not improved post tPA.

Mobility (discharge performance) - lying to sitting on side of bed

Supervision or touching assistance - Helper provides verbal cues and/or touching/steadying and/or contact guard assistance as person completes activity. Assistance may be provided throught the activity or intermittently.
Dependent - Helper does all of the effort. Resident does none of the effort to complete the activity. Or, the assistance of 2 or more helpers is required for the resident to complete the activity.
MDS v3.0 - RAI v1.18.11 - Nursing home discharge (ND) item set during assessment period [CMS Assessment]
Substantial/maximal assistance - Helper does more than half the effort. Helper lifts or holds trunk or limbs and provides more than half the effort.
Dependent - Helper does all of the effort. Resident does none of the effort to complete the activity. Or, the assistance of 2 or more helpers is required for the resident to complete the activity.
MDS v3.0 - RAI v1.18.11 - Nursing home discharge (ND) item set during assessment period [CMS Assessment]
Mobility (discharge performance) - walk 50 feet w/2 turns
Partial/moderate assistance - helper does less than half the effort. Helper lifts, holds or supports trunk or limbs, but provides less than half the effort.
